com.w2.api.engine.robots

Class Robot

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.w2.api.engine.robots.Robot

  • public abstract class Robot
extends java.lang.Object
    `Robot` has a 1-to-1 mapping to a physical Wonder Workshop robot.

    Caller can execute robot commands (via `RobotCommandSet`) and analyze robot state data (via `RobotSensorSet`) to control robots as desired.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Robot() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void cancelCommandSetSequence()
      Stops execution of the current 'CommandSetSequence' being executed by the Robot.
      abstract void connect(Context ctxt)
      Establishes connection to a robot.

      If a connection to robot is successfully established (or if the robot is already connected), a RobotConnected object is posted to the System Event Bus.
      To register to the System Event bus refer to EventBusFactory.getSystemBus()

      If the connection attempt fails, a RobotConnectionFailed object is posted to the System Event Bus.
      abstract void disconnect()
      Disconnects an active connection from a robot.

      This method is nonblocking and does not fail, so caller should consider the robot disconnected once this method finishes.
      abstract CommandSetSequence getCommandSetSequence() 
      abstract java.lang.String getFirmwareVersion() 
      abstract RobotSensorHistory getHistory() 
      abstract java.lang.String getName() 
      abstract int getRobotId() 
      abstract RobotType getRobotType() 
      abstract RobotConnectionState getState() 
      abstract boolean isConnected()
      Returns true if robot is connected and ready to receive commands (and currently emitting sensor).
      abstract boolean isSameRobot(Robot robot)
      Returns true if this robot is the same as the provided robot.
      abstract boolean isUnconfigured()
      Returns true if robot is not properly configured by the Wonder Workshop Go app.
      abstract void reboot()
      Power cycles the physical robot and clears any queued commands.
      abstract void resetState()
      Resets the robot to its initial state.

      Initial state means:
      - Lights will reflect its personality color.
      - All movements are stopped.
      - The head faces center and is level.
      - The eye blinks.
      abstract void sendCommandSet(RobotCommandSet cmdSet)
      Sends the given `RobotCommandSet` to the physical robot to execute.
      abstract void startCommandSetSequence(CommandSetSequence sequence)
      Starts to execute the given `CommandSetSequence` immediately.

      When executing multiple sequences, the sequence is progress is stopped before the next sequence is executed.

      When a robot is done executing a 'CommandSetSequence', a 'RobotCommandSetSequenceFinished' object is posted to the Robot Event Bus.
      abstract void subscribeEvent(GestureEvent event)
      Subscribe for a specific GestureEvent event.
      abstract void unsubscribeEvent(GestureEvent event)
      Unsubscribe a specific GestureEvent event.

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()

        The human-readable name of the robot (read-only).

      • getHistory

        public abstract RobotSensorHistory getHistory()
        Returns:
        The entire history of received `RobotSensorSet` objects.

      • getRobotType

        public abstract RobotType getRobotType()
        Returns:
        The type of this robot (read-only).

      • getState

        public abstract RobotConnectionState getState()
        Returns:
        the connection status of this robot (read-only).

      • getRobotId

        public abstract int getRobotId()
        Returns:
        The unique identifier of this robot (read-only).

      • getFirmwareVersion

        public abstract java.lang.String getFirmwareVersion()
        Returns:
        The firmware version that is currently running on this robot (read-only).

      • isUnconfigured

        public abstract boolean isUnconfigured()
        Returns true if robot is not properly configured by the Wonder Workshop Go app.
        Returns:
        Returns true if unconfigured, false otherwise.

      • isConnected

        public abstract boolean isConnected()
        Returns true if robot is connected and ready to receive commands (and currently emitting sensor).
        Returns:
        Returns true if connected, false otherwise.

      • isSameRobot

        public abstract boolean isSameRobot(Robot robot)
        Returns true if this robot is the same as the provided robot.

        Comparison is done using Robot Id.
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot with which to be compared.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this robot is the same as the specified robot.

      • sendCommandSet

        public abstract void sendCommandSet(RobotCommandSet cmdSet)
        Sends the given `RobotCommandSet` to the physical robot to execute.

        The given command might not be sent immediately, but will be sent within 50ms. If sendRobotCommandSet is called multiple times immediately, the `Robot` might aggregate and send them as a single command set. If there are collisions during command aggregation, the latest command might override earlier commands.
        Parameters:
        cmdSet - The desired command set to send to the robot.

      • startCommandSetSequence

        public abstract void startCommandSetSequence(CommandSetSequence sequence)
        Starts to execute the given `CommandSetSequence` immediately.

        When executing multiple sequences, the sequence is progress is stopped before the next sequence is executed.

        When a robot is done executing a 'CommandSetSequence', a 'RobotCommandSetSequenceFinished' object is posted to the Robot Event Bus. To register to the Robot Specific Event bus refer to EventBusFactory.getRobotEventBus(int)
        Parameters:
        sequence - `CommandSetSequence` object to execute on.

      • cancelCommandSetSequence

        public abstract void cancelCommandSetSequence()
        Stops execution of the current 'CommandSetSequence' being executed by the Robot. If this robot is not currently executing this sequence, then this is a no-op.

        When a robot is done stopping a 'CommandSetSequence', a 'RobotCommandSetSequenceStopped' object is posted to the Robot Event Bus. To register to the Robot Specific Event bus refer to EventBusFactory.getRobotEventBus(int)

      • getCommandSetSequence

        public abstract CommandSetSequence getCommandSetSequence()
        Returns:
        The current 'CommandSetSequence' that is being executed by the robot.

      • reboot

        public abstract void reboot()
        Power cycles the physical robot and clears any queued commands.

      • resetState

        public abstract void resetState()
        Resets the robot to its initial state.

        Initial state means:
        - Lights will reflect its personality color.
        - All movements are stopped.
        - The head faces center and is level.
        - The eye blinks.

      • connect

        public abstract void connect(Context ctxt)
        Establishes connection to a robot.

        If a connection to robot is successfully established (or if the robot is already connected), a RobotConnected object is posted to the System Event Bus.
        To register to the System Event bus refer to EventBusFactory.getSystemBus()

        If the connection attempt fails, a RobotConnectionFailed object is posted to the System Event Bus.
        Parameters:
        ctxt - Android Context for connecting

      • disconnect

        public abstract void disconnect()
        Disconnects an active connection from a robot.

        This method is nonblocking and does not fail, so caller should consider the robot disconnected once this method finishes. Once the robot is successfully disconnected, a 'RobotDisconnected' object is posted to the System Event Bus.
        To register to the System Event bus refer to EventBusFactory.getSystemBus()

      • subscribeEvent

        public abstract void subscribeEvent(GestureEvent event)
        Subscribe for a specific GestureEvent event. If given event is already in the data source (using equals()), then this operation is a no-op.
        Parameters:
        event - The event object to be inserted.

      • unsubscribeEvent

        public abstract void unsubscribeEvent(GestureEvent event)
        Unsubscribe a specific GestureEvent event. If given event is not registered, then this operation is a no-op.
        Parameters:
        event - The event object to be inserted.
